steps.description: According to Figure 6, randomly select three switch ports to connect with the tester, assign as port 1, port 2, and port 3, configure the switch as absolute priority, set switch port trunk mode to ensure VLAN1 is not stripped;
Ports 1 and 2 send data to port 3 simultaneously;
Construct two data streams with priorities 7 and 5 on port 1, and two data streams with priorities 3 and 1 on port 2, set VLAN1 priorities as 7 and 5, 3 and 1;
Test with frame length of 64 bytes, test duration 30s, port load set to 100%;
Record the frame loss rate of different data streams, and determine whether the priority is set successfully.
steps.expected_result: The frame loss rate of different data streams is consistent with the priority setting.

comments.id: Unique identifier for the test case.
comments.title: Title of the test case, briefly describing the test content.
comments.objective: Purpose of the test, indicating the function or feature to be verified by this test case.
comments.test_reference: Reference documents for the test case, such as RFC section numbers, etc.
comments.steps: Detailed description of test steps. Each step includes: step_id: unique identifier for the step. description: specific operation or configuration for the step. expected_result: expected result for the step.
comments.tags: Tags for the test case, used for classification or filtering. Types include: ['function', 'performance']
